edu.calpoly.spritely

Interface Tile

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImageTile, SolidColorTile

    public interface Tile
    A tile that can be displayed in a SpriteWindow. A tile must be immutable, that is, a given Tile instance shall display the identical contents each time it is displayed. Tiles shall not override equals() or hashCode(); instance identity is used to determine if the tiles displayed in a given grid square have changed from frame to frame.
    See Also:
    SolidColorTile, ImageTile

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getText()
      Gives the text representation of this tile.
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g, Size size)
      Paints this tile into the given graphics context g.

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
           Size size)
        Paints this tile into the given graphics context g. g will be set up so that tiles that are underneath this tile will show through if this tile has transparent, or semi-transparent pixels.

        Note that Spritely optimizes repainting. It will only paint a frame if it needs to, because a different set of tiles is on a given square. See the documentation about immutability at the beginning of this class.

        Parameters:
        g - The Java graphics context to draw into, with an appropriate translation and crop already set.
        size - The size of this tile. For a given window, the value of size will never change.
        See Also:
        AlphaComposite.SrcOver

      • getText

        char getText()
        Gives the text representation of this tile.
        Returns:
        the character representation of this tile in text mode.
